Hebrew: אֵיכָ֣ה ׀ יָשְׁבָ֣ה בָדָ֗ד הָעִיר֙ רַבָּ֣תִי עָ֔ם הָיְתָ֖ה כְּאַלְמָנָ֑ה רַבָּ֣תִי בַגּוֹיִ֗ם שָׂרָ֙תִי֙ בַּמְּדִינ֔וֹת הָיְתָ֖ה לָמַֽס׃ {ס}
Translated:
Alas!
Lonely sits the city
Once great with people!
She that was great among nations
Is become like a widow;
The princess among states
Is become a thrall.
Transliteration: eykhah yashevah vadad haiyr ravatiy am hayetah khealemanah ravatiy vagvoyim sharatiy vamediynvot hayetah lamas {s}

Hebrew: בָּכ֨וֹ תִבְכֶּ֜ה בַּלַּ֗יְלָה וְדִמְעָתָהּ֙ עַ֣ל לֶֽחֱיָ֔הּ אֵֽין־לָ֥הּ מְנַחֵ֖ם מִכׇּל־אֹהֲבֶ֑יהָ כׇּל־רֵעֶ֙יהָ֙ בָּ֣גְדוּ בָ֔הּ הָ֥יוּ לָ֖הּ לְאֹיְבִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
Bitterly she weeps in the night,
Her cheek wet with tears.
There is none to comfort her
Of all her friends.
All her allies have betrayed her;
They have become her foes.
Transliteration: vakhvo tivekheh valayelah vedimeatah al lecheyah eyn-lah menachem mikhׇl-ohaveyha khׇl-reeyha vagedu vah hayu lah leoyeviym {s}

Hebrew: גָּֽלְתָ֨ה יְהוּדָ֤ה מֵעֹ֙נִי֙ וּמֵרֹ֣ב עֲבֹדָ֔ה הִ֚יא יָשְׁבָ֣ה בַגּוֹיִ֔ם לֹ֥א מָצְאָ֖ה מָנ֑וֹחַ כׇּל־רֹדְפֶ֥יהָ הִשִּׂיג֖וּהָ בֵּ֥ין הַמְּצָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
Judah has gone into exile
Because of misery and harsh oppression;
When she settled among the nations,
She found no rest;
All her pursuers overtook her
In the narrow places.
Transliteration: galetah yehudah meoniy umerov avodah hiy yashevah vagvoyim lo matseah manvocha khׇl-rodefeyha hishiyguha veyn hametsariym {s}

Hebrew: דַּרְכֵ֨י צִיּ֜וֹן אֲבֵל֗וֹת מִבְּלִי֙ בָּאֵ֣י מוֹעֵ֔ד כׇּל־שְׁעָרֶ֙יהָ֙ שֽׁוֹמֵמִ֔ין כֹּהֲנֶ֖יהָ נֶאֱנָחִ֑ים בְּתוּלֹתֶ֥יהָ נּוּג֖וֹת וְהִ֥יא מַר־לָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Zion’s roads are in mourning,
Empty of festival pilgrims;
All her gates are deserted.
Her priests sigh,
Her maidens are unhappy—
She is utterly disconsolate!
Transliteration: darekhey tsiyyvon avelvot miveliy vaey mvoed khׇl-sheareyha shvomemiyn khohaneyha neenachiym vetuloteyha nugvot vehiy mar-lah {s}

Hebrew: הָי֨וּ צָרֶ֤יהָ לְרֹאשׁ֙ אֹיְבֶ֣יהָ שָׁל֔וּ כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֥ה הוֹגָ֖הּ עַ֣ל רֹב־פְּשָׁעֶ֑יהָ עוֹלָלֶ֛יהָ הָלְכ֥וּ שְׁבִ֖י לִפְנֵי־צָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Her enemies are now the masters,
Her foes are at ease,
Because the LORD has afflicted her
For her many transgressions;
Her infants have gone into captivity
Before the enemy.
Transliteration: hayu tsareyha lerosh oyeveyha shalu khiy-yehovah hvogah al rov-feshaeyha volaleyha halekhu sheviy lifeney-tsar {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א (מן בת) [מִבַּת־]צִיּ֖וֹן כׇּל־הֲדָרָ֑הּ הָי֣וּ שָׂרֶ֗יהָ כְּאַיָּלִים֙ לֹא־מָצְא֣וּ מִרְעֶ֔ה וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ בְלֹא־כֹ֖חַ לִפְנֵ֥י רוֹדֵֽף׃ {ס}
Translated:
Gone from Fair Zion are all
That were her glory;
Her leaders were like stags
That found no pasture;
They could only walk feebly
Before the pursuer.
Transliteration: vayetse (mn vt) [mivat-]tsiyyvon khׇl-hadarah hayu shareyha kheayaliym lo-matseu mireeh vayelekhu velo-khocha lifeney rvodef {s}

Hebrew: זָֽכְרָ֣ה יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם יְמֵ֤י עׇנְיָהּ֙ וּמְרוּדֶ֔יהָ כֹּ֚ל מַחֲמֻדֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֖וּ מִ֣ימֵי קֶ֑דֶם בִּנְפֹ֧ל עַמָּ֣הּ בְּיַד־צָ֗ר וְאֵ֤ין עוֹזֵר֙ לָ֔הּ רָא֣וּהָ צָרִ֔ים שָׂחֲק֖וּ עַ֥ל מִשְׁבַּתֶּֽהָ׃ {ס}
Translated:
All the precious things she had
In the days of old
Jerusalem recalled
In her days of woe and sorrow,
When her people fell by enemy hands
With none to help her;
When enemies looked on and gloated
Over her downfall.
Transliteration: zakherah yerushala͏im yemey ׇneyah umerudeyha khol machamudeyha asher hayu miymey kedem vinefol amah veyad-tsar veeyn vozer lah rauha tsariym shachaku al mishevateha {s}

Hebrew: חֵ֤טְא חָֽטְאָה֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם עַל־כֵּ֖ן לְנִידָ֣ה הָיָ֑תָה כׇּֽל־מְכַבְּדֶ֤יהָ הִזִּיל֙וּהָ֙ כִּי־רָא֣וּ עֶרְוָתָ֔הּ גַּם־הִ֥יא נֶאֶנְחָ֖ה וַתָּ֥שׇׁב אָחֽוֹר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Jerusalem has greatly sinned,
Therefore she is become a mockery.
All who admired her despise her,
For they have seen her disgraced;
And she can only sigh
And shrink back.
Transliteration: chete chateah yerushala͏im al-khen leniydah hayatah khׇl-mekhavedeyha hiziyluha khiy-rau erevatah gam-hiy neenechah vatashׇv achvor {s}

Hebrew: טֻמְאָתָ֣הּ בְּשׁוּלֶ֗יהָ לֹ֤א זָֽכְרָה֙ אַחֲרִיתָ֔הּ וַתֵּ֣רֶד פְּלָאִ֔ים אֵ֥ין מְנַחֵ֖ם לָ֑הּ רְאֵ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־עׇנְיִ֔י כִּ֥י הִגְדִּ֖יל אוֹיֵֽב׃ {ס}
Translated:
Her uncleanness clings to her skirts.
She gave no thought to her future;
She has sunk appallingly,
With none to comfort her.—
See, O LORD, my misery;
How the enemy jeers!
Transliteration: tumeatah veshuleyha lo zakherah achariytah vatered felaiym eyn menachem lah reeh yehovah et-ׇneyiy khiy higediyl voeiv {s}

Hebrew: יָדוֹ֙ פָּ֣רַשׂ צָ֔ר עַ֖ל כׇּל־מַחֲמַדֶּ֑יהָ כִּֽי־רָאֲתָ֤ה גוֹיִם֙ בָּ֣אוּ מִקְדָּשָׁ֔הּ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּ֔יתָה לֹא־יָבֹ֥אוּ בַקָּהָ֖ל לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The foe has laid hands
On everything dear to her.
She has seen her Sanctuary
Invaded by nations
Which You have denied admission
Into Your community.
Transliteration: yadvo farash tsar al khׇl-machamadeyha khiy-raatah gvoyim vau mikedashah asher tsiviytah lo-yavou vakahal lakhe {s}

Hebrew: כׇּל־עַמָּ֤הּ נֶאֱנָחִים֙ מְבַקְשִׁ֣ים לֶ֔חֶם נָתְנ֧וּ (מחמודיהם) [מַחֲמַדֵּיהֶ֛ם] בְּאֹ֖כֶל לְהָשִׁ֣יב נָ֑פֶשׁ רְאֵ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ וְֽהַבִּ֔יטָה כִּ֥י הָיִ֖יתִי זוֹלֵלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
All her inhabitants sigh
As they search for bread;
They have bartered their treasures for food,
To keep themselves alive.—
See, O LORD, and behold,
How abject I have become!
Transliteration: khׇl-amah neenachiym mevakeshiym lechem natenu (mchmvdyhm) [machamadeyhem] veokhel lehashiyv nafesh reeh yehovah vehaviytah khiy hayiytiy zvolelah {s}

Hebrew: ל֣וֹא אֲלֵיכֶם֮ כׇּל־עֹ֣בְרֵי דֶ֒רֶךְ֒ הַבִּ֣יטוּ וּרְא֔וּ אִם־יֵ֤שׁ מַכְאוֹב֙ כְּמַכְאֹבִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר עוֹלַ֖ל לִ֑י אֲשֶׁר֙ הוֹגָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּי֖וֹם חֲר֥וֹן אַפּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
May it never befall you,
All who pass along the road—
Look about and see:
Is there any agony like mine,
Which was dealt out to me
When the LORD afflicted me
On His day of wrath?
Transliteration: lvo aleykhem khׇl-overey derekhe haviytu ureu im-eish makhevov khemakheoviy asher volal liy asher hvogah yehovah veyvom charvon afvo {s}

Hebrew: מִמָּר֛וֹם שָֽׁלַח־אֵ֥שׁ בְּעַצְמֹתַ֖י וַיִּרְדֶּ֑נָּה פָּרַ֨שׂ רֶ֤שֶׁת לְרַגְלַי֙ הֱשִׁיבַ֣נִי אָח֔וֹר נְתָנַ֙נִי֙ שֹֽׁמֵמָ֔ה כׇּל־הַיּ֖וֹם דָּוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
From above He sent a fire
Down into my bones.
He spread a net for my feet,
He hurled me backward;
He has left me forlorn,
In constant misery.
Transliteration: mimarvom shalach-esh veatsemotay vayiredenah farash reshet leragelay heshiyvaniy achvor netananiy shomemah khׇl-hayyvom davah {s}

Hebrew: נִשְׂקַד֩ עֹ֨ל פְּשָׁעַ֜י בְּיָד֗וֹ יִשְׂתָּ֥רְג֛וּ עָל֥וּ עַל־צַוָּארִ֖י הִכְשִׁ֣יל כֹּחִ֑י נְתָנַ֣נִי אֲדֹנָ֔י בִּידֵ֖י לֹא־אוּכַ֥ל קֽוּם׃ {ס}
Translated:
The yoke of my offenses is bound fast,
Lashed tight by His hand;
Imposed upon my neck,
It saps my strength;
The Lord has delivered me into the hands
Of those I cannot withstand.
Transliteration: nishekad ol feshaay veyadvo yishetaregu alu al-tsavariy hikheshiyl khochiy netananiy adonay viydey lo-ukhal kum {s}

Hebrew: סִלָּ֨ה כׇל־אַבִּירַ֤י ׀ אֲדֹנָי֙ בְּקִרְבִּ֔י קָרָ֥א עָלַ֛י מוֹעֵ֖ד לִשְׁבֹּ֣ר בַּחוּרָ֑י גַּ֚ת דָּרַ֣ךְ אֲדֹנָ֔י לִבְתוּלַ֖ת בַּת־יְהוּדָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
The Lord in my midst has rejected
All my heroes;
He has proclaimed a set time against me
To crush my young men.
As in a press the Lord has trodden
Fair Maiden Judah.
Transliteration: silah khׇl-aviyray adonay vekireviy kara alay mvoed lishevor vachuray gat darakhe adonay livetulat vat-yehudah {s}

Hebrew: עַל־אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ אֲנִ֣י בוֹכִיָּ֗ה עֵינִ֤י ׀ עֵינִי֙ יֹ֣רְדָה מַּ֔יִם כִּֽי־רָחַ֥ק מִמֶּ֛נִּי מְנַחֵ֖ם מֵשִׁ֣יב נַפְשִׁ֑י הָי֤וּ בָנַי֙ שֽׁוֹמֵמִ֔ים כִּ֥י גָבַ֖ר אוֹיֵֽב׃ {ס}
Translated:
For these things do I weep,
My eyes flow with tears:
Far from me is any comforter
Who might revive my spirit;
My children are forlorn,
For the foe has prevailed.
Transliteration: al-eleh aniy vvokhiyah eyniy eyniy yoredah mayiim khiy-rachak mimeniy menachem meshiyv nafeshiy hayu vanay shvomemiym khiy gavar voeiv {s}

Hebrew: פֵּֽרְשָׂ֨ה צִיּ֜וֹן בְּיָדֶ֗יהָ אֵ֤ין מְנַחֵם֙ לָ֔הּ צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב סְבִיבָ֣יו צָרָ֑יו הָיְתָ֧ה יְרוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם לְנִדָּ֖ה בֵּינֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Zion spreads out her hands,
She has no one to comfort her;
The LORD has summoned against Jacob
His enemies all about him;
Jerusalem has become among them
A thing unclean.
Transliteration: fereshah tsiyyvon veyadeyha eyn menachem lah tsivah yehovah leyaakov seviyvayv tsarayv hayetah yerushala͏im lenidah veyneyhem {s}

Hebrew: צַדִּ֥יק ה֛וּא יְהֹוָ֖ה כִּ֣י פִ֣יהוּ מָרִ֑יתִי שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֣א כׇל־[הָֽעַמִּ֗ים] (עמים) וּרְאוּ֙ מַכְאֹבִ֔י בְּתוּלֹתַ֥י וּבַחוּרַ֖י הָלְכ֥וּ בַשֶּֽׁבִי׃ {ס}
Translated:
The LORD is in the right,
For I have disobeyed Him.
Hear, all you peoples,
And behold my agony:
My maidens and my youths
Have gone into captivity!
Transliteration: tsadiyk hu yehovah khiy fiyhu mariytiy shimeu-na khׇl-[haamiym] (mym) ureu makheoviy vetulotay uvachuray halekhu vasheviy {s}

Hebrew: קָרָ֤אתִי לַֽמְאַהֲבַי֙ הֵ֣מָּה רִמּ֔וּנִי כֹּהֲנַ֥י וּזְקֵנַ֖י בָּעִ֣יר גָּוָ֑עוּ כִּֽי־בִקְשׁ֥וּ אֹ֙כֶל֙ לָ֔מוֹ וְיָשִׁ֖יבוּ אֶת־נַפְשָֽׁם׃ {ס}
Translated:
I cried out to my friends,
But they played me false.
My priests and my elders
Have perished in the city
As they searched for food
To keep themselves alive.
Transliteration: karatiy lameahavay hemah rimuniy khohanay uzekenay vaiyr gavau khiy-vikeshu okhel lamvo veyashiyvu et-nafesham {s}

Hebrew: רְאֵ֨ה יְהֹוָ֤ה כִּֽי־צַר־לִי֙ מֵעַ֣י חֳמַרְמָ֔רוּ נֶהְפַּ֤ךְ לִבִּי֙ בְּקִרְבִּ֔י כִּ֥י מָר֖וֹ מָרִ֑יתִי מִח֥וּץ שִׁכְּלָה־חֶ֖רֶב בַּבַּ֥יִת כַּמָּֽוֶת׃ {ס}
Translated:
See, O LORD, the distress I am in!
My heart is in anguish,
I know how wrong I was
To disobey.
Outside the sword deals death;
Indoors, the plague.
Transliteration: reeh yehovah khiy-tsar-liy meay chomaremaru nehefakhe liviy vekireviy khiy marvo mariytiy michuts shikhelah-cherev vavayiit khamavet {s}

Hebrew: שָׁמְע֞וּ כִּ֧י נֶאֱנָחָ֣ה אָ֗נִי אֵ֤ין מְנַחֵם֙ לִ֔י כׇּל־אֹ֨יְבַ֜י שָׁמְע֤וּ רָֽעָתִי֙ שָׂ֔שׂוּ כִּ֥י אַתָּ֖ה עָשִׂ֑יתָ הֵבֵ֥אתָ יוֹם־קָרָ֖אתָ וְיִֽהְי֥וּ כָמֹֽנִי׃ {ס}
Translated:
When they heard how I was sighing,
There was none to comfort me;
All my foes heard of my plight and exulted.
For it is Your doing:
You have brought on the day that You threatened.
Oh, let them become like me!
Transliteration: shameu khiy neenachah aniy eyn menachem liy khׇl-oyevay shameu raatiy shashu khiy atah ashiyta heveta yvom-karata veyiheyu khamoniy {s}

Hebrew: תָּבֹ֨א כׇל־רָעָתָ֤ם לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ וְעוֹלֵ֣ל לָ֔מוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עוֹלַ֛לְתָּ לִ֖י עַ֣ל כׇּל־פְּשָׁעָ֑י כִּֽי־רַבּ֥וֹת אַנְחֹתַ֖י וְלִבִּ֥י דַוָּֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Let all their wrongdoing come before You,
And deal with them
As You have dealt with me
For all my transgressions.
For my sighs are many,
And my heart is sick.
Transliteration: tavo khׇl-raatam lefaneykha vevolel lamvo khaasher volaleta liy al khׇl-feshaay khiy-ravvot anechotay veliviy davay {f}

Hebrew: אֵיכָה֩ יָעִ֨יב בְּאַפּ֤וֹ ׀ אֲדֹנָי֙ אֶת־בַּת־צִיּ֔וֹן הִשְׁלִ֤יךְ מִשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ אֶ֔רֶץ תִּפְאֶ֖רֶת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹא־זָכַ֥ר הֲדֹם־רַגְלָ֖יו בְּי֥וֹם אַפּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Alas!
The Lord in His wrath
Has shamed Fair Zion,
Has cast down from heaven to earth
The majesty of Israel.
He did not remember His Footstool
On His day of wrath.
Transliteration: eykhah yaiyv veafvo adonay et-vat-tsiyyvon hisheliykhe mishamayiim erets tifeeret yisherael velo-zakhar hadom-ragelayv veyvom afvo {s}

Hebrew: בִּלַּ֨ע אֲדֹנָ֜י (לא) [וְלֹ֣א] חָמַ֗ל אֵ֚ת כׇּל־נְא֣וֹת יַעֲקֹ֔ב הָרַ֧ס בְּעֶבְרָת֛וֹ מִבְצְרֵ֥י בַת־יְהוּדָ֖ה הִגִּ֣יעַ לָאָ֑רֶץ חִלֵּ֥ל מַמְלָכָ֖ה וְשָׂרֶֽיהָ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The Lord has laid waste without pity
All the habitations of Jacob;
He has razed in His anger
Fair Judah’s strongholds.
He has brought low in dishonor
The kingdom and its leaders.
Transliteration: vila adonay (l) [velo] chamal et khׇl-nevot yaakov haras veeveratvo mivetserey vat-yehudah higiya laarets chilel mamelakhah veshareyha {s}

Hebrew: גָּדַ֣ע בׇּֽחֳרִי־אַ֗ף כֹּ֚ל קֶ֣רֶן יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הֵשִׁ֥יב אָח֛וֹר יְמִינ֖וֹ מִפְּנֵ֣י אוֹיֵ֑ב וַיִּבְעַ֤ר בְּיַעֲקֹב֙ כְּאֵ֣שׁ לֶֽהָבָ֔ה אָכְלָ֖ה סָבִֽיב׃ {ס}
Translated:
In blazing anger He has cut down
All the might of Israel;
He has withdrawn His right hand
In the presence of the foe;
He has ravaged Jacob like flaming fire,
Consuming on all sides.
Transliteration: gada vׇchoriy-af khol keren yisherael heshiyv achvor yemiynvo mifeney voeiv vayivear veyaakov kheesh lehavah akhelah saviyv {s}

Hebrew: דָּרַ֨ךְ קַשְׁתּ֜וֹ כְּאוֹיֵ֗ב נִצָּ֤ב יְמִינוֹ֙ כְּצָ֔ר וַֽיַּהֲרֹ֔ג כֹּ֖ל מַחֲמַדֵּי־עָ֑יִן בְּאֹ֙הֶל֙ בַּת־צִיּ֔וֹן שָׁפַ֥ךְ כָּאֵ֖שׁ חֲמָתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
He bent His bow like an enemy,
Poised His right hand like a foe;
He slew all who delighted the eye.
He poured out His wrath like fire
In the Tent of Fair Zion.
Transliteration: darakhe kashetvo khevoeiv nitsav yemiynvo khetsar vayaharog khol machamadey-ayiin veohel vat-tsiyyvon shafakhe khaesh chamatvo {s}

Hebrew: הָיָ֨ה אֲדֹנָ֤י ׀ כְּאוֹיֵב֙ בִּלַּ֣ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בִּלַּע֙ כׇּל־אַרְמְנוֹתֶ֔יהָ שִׁחֵ֖ת מִבְצָרָ֑יו וַיֶּ֙רֶב֙ בְּבַת־יְהוּדָ֔ה תַּאֲנִיָּ֖ה וַאֲנִיָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
The Lord has acted like a foe,
He has laid waste Israel,
Laid waste all her citadels,
Destroyed her strongholds.
He has increased within Fair Judah
Mourning and moaning.
Transliteration: hayah adonay khevoeiv vila yisherael vila khׇl-aremenvoteyha shichet mivetsarayv vayerev vevat-yehudah taaniyah vaaniyah {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּחְמֹ֤ס כַּגַּן֙ שֻׂכּ֔וֹ שִׁחֵ֖ת מֹעֲד֑וֹ שִׁכַּ֨ח יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ בְּצִיּוֹן֙ מוֹעֵ֣ד וְשַׁבָּ֔ת וַיִּנְאַ֥ץ בְּזַֽעַם־אַפּ֖וֹ מֶ֥לֶךְ וְכֹהֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated:
He has stripped His Booth like a garden,
He has destroyed His Tabernacle;
The LORD has ended in Zion
Festival and sabbath;
In His raging anger He has spurned
King and priest.
Transliteration: vayachemos khagan shukhvo shichet moadvo shikhach yehovah vetsiyyvon mvoed veshavat vayineats vezaam-afvo melekhe vekhohen {s}

Hebrew: זָנַ֨ח אֲדֹנָ֤י ׀ מִזְבְּחוֹ֙ נִאֵ֣ר מִקְדָּשׁ֔וֹ הִסְגִּיר֙ בְּיַד־אוֹיֵ֔ב חוֹמֹ֖ת אַרְמְנוֹתֶ֑יהָ ק֛וֹל נָתְנ֥וּ בְּבֵית־יְהֹוָ֖ה כְּי֥וֹם מוֹעֵֽד׃ {ס}
Translated:
The Lord has rejected His altar,
Disdained His Sanctuary.
He has handed over to the foe
The walls of its citadels;
They raised a shout in the House of the LORD
As on a festival day.
Transliteration: zanach adonay mizevechvo nier mikedashvo hisegiyr veyad-voeiv chvomot aremenvoteyha kvol natenu veveyt-yehovah kheyvom mvoed {s}

Hebrew: חָשַׁ֨ב יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ לְהַשְׁחִית֙ חוֹמַ֣ת בַּת־צִיּ֔וֹן נָ֣טָה קָ֔ו לֹא־הֵשִׁ֥יב יָד֖וֹ מִבַּלֵּ֑עַ וַיַּֽאֲבֶל־חֵ֥ל וְחוֹמָ֖ה יַחְדָּ֥ו אֻמְלָֽלוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The LORD resolved to destroy
The wall of Fair Zion;
He measured with a line, refrained not
From bringing destruction.
He has made wall and rampart to mourn,
Together they languish.
Transliteration: chashav yehovah lehashechiyt chvomat vat-tsiyyvon natah kav lo-heshiyv yadvo mivalea vayaavel-chel vechvomah yachedav umelalu {s}

Hebrew: טָבְע֤וּ בָאָ֙רֶץ֙ שְׁעָרֶ֔יהָ אִבַּ֥ד וְשִׁבַּ֖ר בְּרִיחֶ֑יהָ מַלְכָּ֨הּ וְשָׂרֶ֤יהָ בַגּוֹיִם֙ אֵ֣ין תּוֹרָ֔ה גַּם־נְבִיאֶ֕יהָ לֹא־מָצְא֥וּ חָז֖וֹן מֵיְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Her gates have sunk into the ground,
He has smashed her bars to bits;
Her king and her leaders are in exile,
Instruction is no more;
Her prophets, too, receive
No vision from the LORD.
Transliteration: taveu vaarets sheareyha ivad veshivar veriycheyha malekhah veshareyha vagvoyim eyn tvorah gam-neviyeyha lo-matseu chazvon meyehovah {s}

Hebrew: יֵשְׁב֨וּ לָאָ֤רֶץ יִדְּמוּ֙ זִקְנֵ֣י בַת־צִיּ֔וֹן הֶֽעֱל֤וּ עָפָר֙ עַל־רֹאשָׁ֔ם חָגְר֖וּ שַׂקִּ֑ים הוֹרִ֤ידוּ לָאָ֙רֶץ֙ רֹאשָׁ֔ן בְּתוּלֹ֖ת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Silent sit on the ground
The elders of Fair Zion;
They have strewn dust on their heads
And girded themselves with sackcloth;
The maidens of Jerusalem have bowed
Their heads to the ground.
Transliteration: eishevu laarets yidemu zikeney vat-tsiyyvon heelu afar al-rosham chageru shakiym hvoriydu laarets roshan vetulot yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: כָּל֨וּ בַדְּמָע֤וֹת עֵינַי֙ חֳמַרְמְר֣וּ מֵעַ֔י נִשְׁפַּ֤ךְ לָאָ֙רֶץ֙ כְּבֵדִ֔י עַל־שֶׁ֖בֶר בַּת־עַמִּ֑י בֵּֽעָטֵ֤ף עוֹלֵל֙ וְיוֹנֵ֔ק בִּרְחֹב֖וֹת קִרְיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
My eyes are spent with tears,
My heart is in tumult,
My being melts away
Over the ruin of my poor people,
As babes and sucklings languish
In the squares of the city.
Transliteration: khalu vademavot eynay chomaremeru meay nishefakhe laarets khevediy al-shever vat-amiy veatef volel veyvonek virechovvot kireyah {s}

Hebrew: לְאִמֹּתָם֙ יֹֽאמְר֔וּ אַיֵּ֖ה דָּגָ֣ן וָיָ֑יִן בְּהִֽתְעַטְּפָ֤ם כֶּֽחָלָל֙ בִּרְחֹב֣וֹת עִ֔יר בְּהִשְׁתַּפֵּ֣ךְ נַפְשָׁ֔ם אֶל־חֵ֖יק אִמֹּתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
They keep asking their mothers,
“Where is bread and wine?”
As they languish like battle-wounded
In the squares of the town,
As their life runs out
In their mothers’ bosoms.
Transliteration: leimotam yomeru ayeh dagan vayayiin vehiteatefam khechalal virechovvot iyr vehishetafekhe nafesham el-cheyk imotam {s}

Hebrew: מָֽה־אֲעִידֵ֞ךְ מָ֣ה אֲדַמֶּה־לָּ֗ךְ הַבַּת֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם מָ֤ה אַשְׁוֶה־לָּךְ֙ וַאֲנַֽחֲמֵ֔ךְ בְּתוּלַ֖ת בַּת־צִיּ֑וֹן כִּֽי־גָד֥וֹל כַּיָּ֛ם שִׁבְרֵ֖ךְ מִ֥י יִרְפָּא־לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
What can I take as witness or liken
To you, O Fair Jerusalem?
What can I match with you to console you,
O Fair Maiden Zion?
For your ruin is vast as the sea:
Who can heal you?
Transliteration: mah-aiydekhe mah adameh-lakhe havat yerushala͏im mah asheveh-lakhe vaanachamekhe vetulat vat-tsiyyvon khiy-gadvol khayam shiverekhe miy yirefa-lakhe {s}

Hebrew: נְבִיאַ֗יִךְ חָ֤זוּ לָךְ֙ שָׁ֣וְא וְתָפֵ֔ל וְלֹֽא־גִלּ֥וּ עַל־עֲוֺנֵ֖ךְ לְהָשִׁ֣יב (שביתך) [שְׁבוּתֵ֑ךְ] וַיֶּ֣חֱזוּ לָ֔ךְ מַשְׂא֥וֹת שָׁ֖וְא וּמַדּוּחִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
Your seers prophesied to you
Delusion and folly.
They did not expose your iniquity
So as to restore your fortunes,
But prophesied to you oracles
Of delusion and deception.
Transliteration: neviyayiikhe chazu lakhe shave vetafel velo-gilu al-avonekhe lehashiyv (shvytkh) [shevutekhe] vayechezu lakhe mashevot shave umaduchiym {s}

Hebrew: סָֽפְק֨וּ עָלַ֤יִךְ כַּפַּ֙יִם֙ כׇּל־עֹ֣בְרֵי דֶ֔רֶךְ שָֽׁרְקוּ֙ וַיָּנִ֣עוּ רֹאשָׁ֔ם עַל־בַּ֖ת יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם הֲזֹ֣את הָעִ֗יר שֶׁיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ כְּלִ֣ילַת יֹ֔פִי מָשׂ֖וֹשׂ לְכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
All who pass your way
Clap their hands at you;
They hiss and wag their head
At Fair Jerusalem:
“Is this the city that was called
Perfect in Beauty,
Joy of All the Earth?”
Transliteration: safeku alayiikhe khafayiim khׇl-overey derekhe shareku vayaniu rosham al-vat yerushala͏im hazot haiyr sheyomeru kheliylat yofiy mashvosh lekhׇl-haarets {s}

Hebrew: פָּצ֨וּ עָלַ֤יִךְ פִּיהֶם֙ כׇּל־אֹ֣יְבַ֔יִךְ שָֽׁרְקוּ֙ וַיַּֽחַרְקוּ־שֵׁ֔ן אָמְר֖וּ בִּלָּ֑עְנוּ אַ֣ךְ זֶ֥ה הַיּ֛וֹם שֶׁקִּוִּינֻ֖הוּ מָצָ֥אנוּ רָאִֽינוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
All your enemies
Jeer at you;
They hiss and gnash their teeth,
And cry: “We’ve ruined her!
Ah, this is the day we hoped for;
We have lived to see it!”
Transliteration: fatsu alayiikhe fiyhem khׇl-oyevayiikhe shareku vayachareku-shen ameru vilaenu akhe zeh hayyvom shekiviynuhu matsanu raiynu {s}

Hebrew: עָשָׂ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר זָמָ֗ם בִּצַּ֤ע אֶמְרָתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה מִֽימֵי־קֶ֔דֶם הָרַ֖ס וְלֹ֣א חָמָ֑ל וַיְשַׂמַּ֤ח עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ אוֹיֵ֔ב הֵרִ֖ים קֶ֥רֶן צָרָֽיִךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The LORD has done what He purposed,
Has carried out the decree
That He ordained long ago;
He has torn down without pity.
He has let the foe rejoice over you,
Has exalted the might of your enemies.
Transliteration: ashah yehovah asher zamam vitsa emeratvo asher tsivah miymey-kedem haras velo chamal vayeshamach alayiikhe voeiv heriym keren tsarayiikhe {s}

Hebrew: צָעַ֥ק לִבָּ֖ם אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֑י חוֹמַ֣ת בַּת־צִ֠יּ֠וֹן הוֹרִ֨ידִי כַנַּ֤חַל דִּמְעָה֙ יוֹמָ֣ם וָלַ֔יְלָה אַֽל־תִּתְּנִ֤י פוּגַת֙ לָ֔ךְ אַל־תִּדֹּ֖ם בַּת־עֵינֵֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Their heart cried out to the Lord.
O wall of Fair Zion,
Shed tears like a torrent
Day and night!
Give yourself no respite,
Your eyes no rest.
Transliteration: tsaak livam el-adonay chvomat vat-tsiyyvon hvoriydiy khanachal dimeah yvomam valayelah al-titeniy fugat lakhe al-tidom vat-eynekhe {s}

Hebrew: ק֣וּמִי ׀ רֹ֣נִּי (בליל) [בַלַּ֗יְלָה] לְרֹאשׁ֙ אַשְׁמֻר֔וֹת שִׁפְכִ֤י כַמַּ֙יִם֙ לִבֵּ֔ךְ נֹ֖כַח פְּנֵ֣י אֲדֹנָ֑י שְׂאִ֧י אֵלָ֣יו כַּפַּ֗יִךְ עַל־נֶ֙פֶשׁ֙ עֽוֹלָלַ֔יִךְ הָעֲטוּפִ֥ים בְּרָעָ֖ב בְּרֹ֥אשׁ כׇּל־חוּצֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
Arise, cry out in the night
At the beginning of the watches,
Pour out your heart like water
In the presence of the Lord!
Lift up your hands to Him
For the life of your infants,
Who faint for hunger
At every street corner.
Transliteration: kumiy roniy (vlyl) [valayelah] lerosh ashemurvot shifekhiy khamayiim livekhe nokhach feney adonay sheiy elayv khafayiikhe al-nefesh volalayiikhe haatufiym veraav verosh khׇl-chutsvot {s}

Hebrew: רְאֵ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ וְֽהַבִּ֔יטָה לְמִ֖י עוֹלַ֣לְתָּ כֹּ֑ה אִם־תֹּאכַ֨לְנָה נָשִׁ֤ים פִּרְיָם֙ עֹלְלֵ֣י טִפֻּחִ֔ים אִם־יֵהָרֵ֛ג בְּמִקְדַּ֥שׁ אֲדֹנָ֖י כֹּהֵ֥ן וְנָבִֽיא׃ {ס}
Translated:
See, O LORD, and behold,
To whom You have done this!
Alas, women eat their own fruit,
Their new-born babes!
Alas, priest and prophet are slain
In the Sanctuary of the Lord!
Transliteration: reeh yehovah vehaviytah lemiy volaleta khoh im-tokhalenah nashiym fireyam oleley tifuchiym im-eihareg vemikedash adonay khohen venaviy {s}

Hebrew: שָׁכְב֨וּ לָאָ֤רֶץ חוּצוֹת֙ נַ֣עַר וְזָקֵ֔ן בְּתוּלֹתַ֥י וּבַחוּרַ֖י נָפְל֣וּ בֶחָ֑רֶב הָרַ֙גְתָּ֙ בְּי֣וֹם אַפֶּ֔ךָ טָבַ֖חְתָּ לֹ֥א חָמָֽלְתָּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Prostrate in the streets lie
Both young and old.
My maidens and youths
Are fallen by the sword;
You slew them on Your day of wrath,
You slaughtered without pity.
Transliteration: shakhevu laarets chutsvot naar vezaken vetulotay uvachuray nafelu vecharev harageta veyvom afekha tavacheta lo chamaleta {s}

Hebrew: תִּקְרָא֩ כְי֨וֹם מוֹעֵ֤ד מְגוּרַי֙ מִסָּבִ֔יב וְלֹ֥א הָיָ֛ה בְּי֥וֹם אַף־יְהֹוָ֖ה פָּלִ֣יט וְשָׂרִ֑יד אֲשֶׁר־טִפַּ֥חְתִּי וְרִבִּ֖יתִי אֹיְבִ֥י כִלָּֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
You summoned, as on a festival,
My neighbors from round about.
On the day of the wrath of the LORD,
None survived or escaped;
Those whom I bore and reared
My foe has consumed.
Transliteration: tikera kheyvom mvoed meguray misaviyv velo hayah veyvom af-yehovah faliyt veshariyd asher-tifachetiy veriviytiy oyeviy khilam {f}

Hebrew: אֲנִ֤י הַגֶּ֙בֶר֙ רָאָ֣ה עֳנִ֔י בְּשֵׁ֖בֶט עֶבְרָתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
I am the man who has known affliction
Under the rod of His wrath;
Transliteration: aniy hagever raah oniy veshevet everatvo {s}

Hebrew: אוֹתִ֥י נָהַ֛ג וַיֹּלַ֖ךְ חֹ֥שֶׁךְ וְלֹא־אֽוֹר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Me He drove on and on
In unrelieved darkness;
Transliteration: votiy nahag vayolakhe choshekhe velo-vor {s}

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ בִּ֥י יָשֻׁ֛ב יַהֲפֹ֥ךְ יָד֖וֹ כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃ {ס}
Translated:
On none but me He brings down His hand
Again and again, without cease.
Transliteration: akhe viy yashuv yahafokhe yadvo khׇl-hayyvom {s}

Hebrew: בִּלָּ֤ה בְשָׂרִי֙ וְעוֹרִ֔י שִׁבַּ֖ר עַצְמוֹתָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
He has worn away my flesh and skin;
He has shattered my bones.
Transliteration: vilah veshariy vevoriy shivar atsemvotay {s}

Hebrew: בָּנָ֥ה עָלַ֛י וַיַּקַּ֖ף רֹ֥אשׁ וּתְלָאָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
All around me He has built
Misery and hardship;
Transliteration: vanah alay vayakaf rosh utelaah {s}

Hebrew: בְּמַחֲשַׁכִּ֥ים הוֹשִׁיבַ֖נִי כְּמֵתֵ֥י עוֹלָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
He has made me dwell in darkness,
Like those long dead.
Transliteration: vemachashakhiym hvoshiyvaniy khemetey volam {s}

Hebrew: גָּדַ֧ר בַּעֲדִ֛י וְלֹ֥א אֵצֵ֖א הִכְבִּ֥יד נְחׇשְׁתִּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
He has walled me in and I cannot break out;
He has weighed me down with chains.
Transliteration: gadar vaadiy velo etse hikheviyd nechׇshetiy {s}

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם כִּ֤י אֶזְעַק֙ וַאֲשַׁוֵּ֔עַ שָׂתַ֖ם תְּפִלָּתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
And when I cry and plead,
He shuts out my prayer;
Transliteration: gam khiy ezeak vaashavea shatam tefilatiy {s}

Hebrew: גָּדַ֤ר דְּרָכַי֙ בְּגָזִ֔ית נְתִיבֹתַ֖י עִוָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
He has walled in my ways with hewn blocks,
He has made my paths a maze.
Transliteration: gadar derakhay vegaziyt netiyvotay ivah {s}

Hebrew: דֹּ֣ב אֹרֵ֥ב הוּא֙ לִ֔י (אריה) [אֲרִ֖י] בְּמִסְתָּרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
He is a lurking bear to me,
A lion in hiding;
Transliteration: dov orev hu liy (ryh) [ariy] vemisetariym {s}

Hebrew: דְּרָכַ֥י סוֹרֵ֛ר וַֽיְפַשְּׁחֵ֖נִי שָׂמַ֥נִי שֹׁמֵֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
He has forced me off my way and mangled me,
He has left me numb.
Transliteration: derakhay svorer vayefashecheniy shamaniy shomem {s}

Hebrew: דָּרַ֤ךְ קַשְׁתּוֹ֙ וַיַּצִּיבֵ֔נִי כַּמַּטָּרָ֖א לַחֵֽץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
He has bent His bow and made me
The target of His arrows:
Transliteration: darakhe kashetvo vayatsiyveniy khamatara lachets {s}

Hebrew: הֵבִיא֙ בְּכִלְיֹתָ֔י בְּנֵ֖י אַשְׁפָּתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
He has shot into my vitals
The shafts of His quiver.
Transliteration: heviy vekhileyotay veney ashefatvo {s}

Hebrew: הָיִ֤יתִי שְּׂחֹק֙ לְכׇל־עַמִּ֔י נְגִינָתָ֖ם כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃ {ס}
Translated:
I have become a laughingstock to all people,
The butt of their gibes all day long.
Transliteration: hayiytiy shechok lekhׇl-amiy negiynatam khׇl-hayyvom {s}

Hebrew: הִשְׂבִּיעַ֥נִי בַמְּרוֹרִ֖ים הִרְוַ֥נִי לַעֲנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
He has filled me with bitterness,
Sated me with wormwood.
Transliteration: hisheviyaniy vamervoriym hirevaniy laanah {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּגְרֵ֤ס בֶּֽחָצָץ֙ שִׁנָּ֔י הִכְפִּישַׁ֖נִי בָּאֵֽפֶר׃ {ס}
Translated:
He has broken my teeth on gravel,
Has ground me into the dust.
Transliteration: vayageres vechatsats shinay hikhefiyshaniy vaefer {s}

Hebrew: וַתִּזְנַ֧ח מִשָּׁל֛וֹם נַפְשִׁ֖י נָשִׁ֥יתִי טוֹבָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
My life was bereft of peace,
I forgot what happiness was.
Transliteration: vatizenach mishalvom nafeshiy nashiytiy tvovah {s}

Hebrew: וָאֹמַר֙ אָבַ֣ד נִצְחִ֔י וְתוֹחַלְתִּ֖י מֵיְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
I thought my strength and hope
Had perished before the LORD.
Transliteration: vaomar avad nitsechiy vetvochaletiy meyehovah {s}

Hebrew: זְכׇר־עׇנְיִ֥י וּמְרוּדִ֖י לַעֲנָ֥ה וָרֹֽאשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated:
To recall my distress and my misery
Was wormwood and poison;
Transliteration: zekhׇr-ׇneyiy umerudiy laanah varosh {s}

Hebrew: זָכ֣וֹר תִּזְכּ֔וֹר (ותשיח) [וְתָשׁ֥וֹחַ] עָלַ֖י נַפְשִֽׁי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Whenever I thought of them,
I was bowed low.
Transliteration: zakhvor tizekhvor (vtshych) [vetashvocha] alay nafeshiy {s}

Hebrew: זֹ֛את אָשִׁ֥יב אֶל־לִבִּ֖י עַל־כֵּ֥ן אוֹחִֽיל׃ {ס}
Translated:
But this do I call to mind,
Therefore I have hope:
Transliteration: zot ashiyv el-liviy al-khen vochiyl {s}

Hebrew: חַֽסְדֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ כִּ֣י לֹא־תָ֔מְנוּ כִּ֥י לֹא־כָל֖וּ רַחֲמָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
The kindness of the LORD has not ended,
His mercies are not spent.
Transliteration: chasedey yehovah khiy lo-tamenu khiy lo-khalu rachamayv {s}

Hebrew: חֲדָשִׁים֙ לַבְּקָרִ֔ים רַבָּ֖ה אֱמוּנָתֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated:
They are renewed every morning—
Ample is Your grace!
Transliteration: chadashiym lavekariym ravah emunatekha {s}

Hebrew: חֶלְקִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אָמְרָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֔י עַל־כֵּ֖ן אוֹחִ֥יל לֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
“The LORD is my portion,” I say with full heart;
Therefore will I hope in Him.
Transliteration: chelekiy yehovah amerah nafeshiy al-khen vochiyl lvo {s}

Hebrew: ט֤וֹב יְהֹוָה֙ לְקֹוָ֔ו לְנֶ֖פֶשׁ תִּדְרְשֶֽׁנּוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The LORD is good to those who trust in Him,
To the one who seeks Him;
Transliteration: tvov yehovah lekovav lenefesh tidereshenu {s}

Hebrew: ט֤וֹב וְיָחִיל֙ וְדוּמָ֔ם לִתְשׁוּעַ֖ת יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
It is good to wait patiently
Till rescue comes from the LORD.
Transliteration: tvov veyachiyl vedumam liteshuat yehovah {s}

Hebrew: ט֣וֹב לַגֶּ֔בֶר כִּֽי־יִשָּׂ֥א עֹ֖ל בִּנְעוּרָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
It is good for a man, when young,
To bear a yoke;
Transliteration: tvov lagever khiy-yisha ol vineurayv {s}

Hebrew: יֵשֵׁ֤ב בָּדָד֙ וְיִדֹּ֔ם כִּ֥י נָטַ֖ל עָלָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
Let him sit alone and be patient,
When He has laid it upon him.
Transliteration: eishev vadad veyidom khiy natal alayv {s}

Hebrew: יִתֵּ֤ן בֶּֽעָפָר֙ פִּ֔יהוּ אוּלַ֖י יֵ֥שׁ תִּקְוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Let him put his mouth to the dust—
There may yet be hope.
Transliteration: yiten veafar fiyhu ulay eish tikevah {s}

Hebrew: יִתֵּ֧ן לְמַכֵּ֛הוּ לֶ֖חִי יִשְׂבַּ֥ע בְּחֶרְפָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Let him offer his cheek to the smiter;
Let him be surfeited with mockery.
Transliteration: yiten lemakhehu lechiy yisheva vecherefah {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֥א יִזְנַ֛ח לְעוֹלָ֖ם אֲדֹנָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
For the Lord does not
Reject forever,
Transliteration: khiy lo yizenach levolam adonay {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־הוֹגָ֔ה וְרִחַ֖ם כְּרֹ֥ב חֲסָדָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
But first afflicts, then pardons
In His abundant kindness.
Transliteration: khiy im-hvogah vericham kherov chasadayv {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א עִנָּה֙ מִלִּבּ֔וֹ וַיַּגֶּ֖ה בְּנֵי־אִֽישׁ׃ {ס}
Translated:
For He does not willfully bring grief
Or affliction to man,
Transliteration: khiy lo inah milivvo vayageh veney-iysh {s}

Hebrew: לְדַכֵּא֙ תַּ֣חַת רַגְלָ֔יו כֹּ֖ל אֲסִ֥ירֵי אָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Crushing under His feet
All the prisoners of the earth.
Transliteration: ledakhe tachat ragelayv khol asiyrey arets {s}

Hebrew: לְהַטּוֹת֙ מִשְׁפַּט־גָּ֔בֶר נֶ֖גֶד פְּנֵ֥י עֶלְיֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated:
To deny a man his rights
In the presence of the Most High,
Transliteration: lehatvot mishefat-gaver neged feney eleyvon {s}

Hebrew: לְעַוֵּ֤ת אָדָם֙ בְּרִיב֔וֹ אֲדֹנָ֖י לֹ֥א רָאָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
To wrong a man in his cause—
This the Lord does not choose.
Transliteration: leavet adam veriyvvo adonay lo raah {s}

Hebrew: מִ֣י זֶ֤ה אָמַר֙ וַתֶּ֔הִי אֲדֹנָ֖י לֹ֥א צִוָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Whose decree was ever fulfilled,
Unless the Lord willed it?
Transliteration: miy zeh amar vatehiy adonay lo tsivah {s}

Hebrew: מִפִּ֤י עֶלְיוֹן֙ לֹ֣א תֵצֵ֔א הָרָע֖וֹת וְהַטּֽוֹב׃ {ס}
Translated:
Is it not at the word of the Most High,
That weal and woe befall?
Transliteration: mifiy eleyvon lo tetse haravot vehatvov {s}

Hebrew: מַה־יִּתְאוֹנֵן֙ אָדָ֣ם חָ֔י גֶּ֖בֶר עַל־חֲטָאָֽו׃ {ס}
Translated:
Of what shall a living man complain?
Each one of his own sins!
Transliteration: mah-yitevonen adam chay gever al-chataav {s}

Hebrew: נַחְפְּשָׂ֤ה דְרָכֵ֙ינוּ֙ וְֽנַחְקֹ֔רָה וְנָשׁ֖וּבָה עַד־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Let us search and examine our ways,
And turn back to the LORD;
Transliteration: nachefeshah derakheynu venachekorah venashuvah ad-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: נִשָּׂ֤א לְבָבֵ֙נוּ֙ אֶל־כַּפָּ֔יִם אֶל־אֵ֖ל בַּשָּׁמָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Let us lift up our hearts with our hands
To God in heaven:
Transliteration: nisha levavenu el-khafayiim el-el vashamayiim {s}

Hebrew: נַ֤חְנוּ פָשַׁ֙עְנוּ֙ וּמָרִ֔ינוּ אַתָּ֖ה לֹ֥א סָלָֽחְתָּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
We have transgressed and rebelled,
And You have not forgiven.
Transliteration: nachenu fashaenu umariynu atah lo salacheta {s}

Hebrew: סַכּ֤וֹתָה בָאַף֙ וַֽתִּרְדְּפֵ֔נוּ הָרַ֖גְתָּ לֹ֥א חָמָֽלְתָּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
You have clothed Yourself in anger and pursued us,
You have slain without pity.
Transliteration: sakhvotah vaaf vatiredefenu harageta lo chamaleta {s}

Hebrew: סַכּ֤וֹתָה בֶֽעָנָן֙ לָ֔ךְ מֵעֲב֖וֹר תְּפִלָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
You have screened Yourself off with a cloud,
That no prayer may pass through.
Transliteration: sakhvotah veanan lakhe meavvor tefilah {s}

Hebrew: סְחִ֧י וּמָא֛וֹס תְּשִׂימֵ֖נוּ בְּקֶ֥רֶב הָעַמִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
You have made us filth and refuse
In the midst of the peoples.
Transliteration: sechiy umavos teshiymenu vekerev haamiym {s}

Hebrew: פָּצ֥וּ עָלֵ֛ינוּ פִּיהֶ֖ם כׇּל־אֹיְבֵֽינוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
All our enemies loudly
Rail against us.
Transliteration: fatsu aleynu fiyhem khׇl-oyeveynu {s}

Hebrew: פַּ֧חַד וָפַ֛חַת הָ֥יָה לָ֖נוּ הַשֵּׁ֥את וְהַשָּֽׁבֶר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Panic and pitfall are our lot,
Death and destruction.
Transliteration: fachad vafachat hayah lanu hashet vehashaver {s}

Hebrew: פַּלְגֵי־מַ֙יִם֙ תֵּרַ֣ד עֵינִ֔י עַל־שֶׁ֖בֶר בַּת־עַמִּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
My eyes shed streams of water
Over the ruin of my poor people.
Transliteration: falegey-mayiim terad eyniy al-shever vat-amiy {s}

Hebrew: עֵינִ֧י נִגְּרָ֛ה וְלֹ֥א תִדְמֶ֖ה מֵאֵ֥ין הֲפֻגֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
My eyes shall flow without cease,
Without respite,
Transliteration: eyniy nigerah velo tidemeh meeyn hafugvot {s}

Hebrew: עַד־יַשְׁקִ֣יף וְיֵ֔רֶא יְהֹוָ֖ה מִשָּׁמָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Until the LORD looks down
And beholds from heaven.
Transliteration: ad-yashekiyf veeire yehovah mishamayiim {s}

Hebrew: עֵינִי֙ עֽוֹלְלָ֣ה לְנַפְשִׁ֔י מִכֹּ֖ל בְּנ֥וֹת עִירִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
My eyes have brought me grief
Over all the maidens of my city.
Transliteration: eyniy volelah lenafeshiy mikhol venvot iyriy {s}

Hebrew: צ֥וֹד צָד֛וּנִי כַּצִּפּ֖וֹר אֹיְבַ֥י חִנָּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
My foes have snared me like a bird,
Without any cause.
Transliteration: tsvod tsaduniy khatsifvor oyevay chinam {s}

Hebrew: צָֽמְת֤וּ בַבּוֹר֙ חַיָּ֔י וַיַּדּוּ־אֶ֖בֶן בִּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
They have ended my life in a pit
And cast stones at me.
Transliteration: tsametu vavvor chayay vayadu-even viy {s}

Hebrew: צָֽפוּ־מַ֥יִם עַל־רֹאשִׁ֖י אָמַ֥רְתִּי נִגְזָֽרְתִּי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Waters flowed over my head;
I said: I am lost!
Transliteration: tsafu-mayiim al-roshiy amaretiy nigezaretiy {s}

Hebrew: קָרָ֤אתִי שִׁמְךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִבּ֖וֹר תַּחְתִּיּֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
I have called on Your name, O LORD,
From the depths of the Pit.
Transliteration: karatiy shimekha yehovah mivvor tachetiyyvot {s}

Hebrew: קוֹלִ֖י שָׁמָ֑עְתָּ אַל־תַּעְלֵ֧ם אׇזְנְךָ֛ לְרַוְחָתִ֖י לְשַׁוְעָתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Hear my plea;
Do not shut Your ear
To my groan, to my cry!
Transliteration: kvoliy shamaeta al-taelem ׇzenekha leravechatiy leshaveatiy {s}

Hebrew: קָרַ֙בְתָּ֙ בְּי֣וֹם אֶקְרָאֶ֔ךָּ אָמַ֖רְתָּ אַל־תִּירָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated:
You have ever drawn nigh when I called You;
You have said, “Do not fear!”
Transliteration: karaveta veyvom ekeraekha amareta al-tiyra {s}

Hebrew: רַ֧בְתָּ אֲדֹנָ֛י רִיבֵ֥י נַפְשִׁ֖י גָּאַ֥לְתָּ חַיָּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
You championed my cause, O Lord,
You have redeemed my life.
Transliteration: raveta adonay riyvey nafeshiy gaaleta chayay {s}

Hebrew: רָאִ֤יתָה יְהֹוָה֙ עַוָּ֣תָתִ֔י שׇׁפְטָ֖ה מִשְׁפָּטִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
You have seen, O LORD, the wrong done me;
Oh, vindicate my right!
Transliteration: raiytah yehovah avatatiy shׇfetah mishefatiy {s}

Hebrew: רָאִ֙יתָה֙ כׇּל־נִקְמָתָ֔ם כׇּל־מַחְשְׁבֹתָ֖ם לִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
You have seen all their malice,
All their designs against me;
Transliteration: raiytah khׇl-nikematam khׇl-macheshevotam liy {s}

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֤עְתָּ חֶרְפָּתָם֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה כׇּל־מַחְשְׁבֹתָ֖ם עָלָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
You have heard, O LORD, their taunts,
All their designs against me,
Transliteration: shamaeta cherefatam yehovah khׇl-macheshevotam alay {s}

Hebrew: שִׂפְתֵ֤י קָמַי֙ וְהֶגְיוֹנָ֔ם עָלַ֖י כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃ {ס}
Translated:
The mouthings and pratings of my adversaries
Against me all day long.
Transliteration: shifetey kamay vehegeyvonam alay khׇl-hayyvom {s}

Hebrew: שִׁבְתָּ֤ם וְקִֽימָתָם֙ הַבִּ֔יטָה אֲנִ֖י מַנְגִּינָתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
See how, at their ease or at work,
I am the butt of their gibes.
Transliteration: shivetam vekiymatam haviytah aniy manegiynatam {s}

Hebrew: תָּשִׁ֨יב לָהֶ֥ם גְּמ֛וּל יְהֹוָ֖ה כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יְדֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Give them, O LORD, their deserts
According to their deeds.
Transliteration: tashiyv lahem gemul yehovah khemaasheh yedeyhem {s}

Hebrew: תִּתֵּ֤ן לָהֶם֙ מְגִנַּת־לֵ֔ב תַּאֲלָֽתְךָ֖ לָהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Give them anguish of heart;
Your curse be upon them!
Transliteration: titen lahem meginat-lev taalatekha lahem {s}

Hebrew: תִּרְדֹּ֤ף בְּאַף֙ וְתַשְׁמִידֵ֔ם מִתַּ֖חַת שְׁמֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Oh, pursue them in wrath and destroy them
From under the heavens of the LORD!
Transliteration: tiredof veaf vetashemiydem mitachat shemey yehovah {f}

Hebrew: אֵיכָה֙ יוּעַ֣ם זָהָ֔ב יִשְׁנֶ֖א הַכֶּ֣תֶם הַטּ֑וֹב תִּשְׁתַּפֵּ֙כְנָה֙ אַבְנֵי־קֹ֔דֶשׁ בְּרֹ֖אשׁ כׇּל־חוּצֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
Alas!
The gold is dulled,
Debased the finest gold!
The sacred gems are spilled
At every street corner.
Transliteration: eykhah yuam zahav yishene hakhetem hatvov tishetafekhenah aveney-kodesh verosh khׇl-chutsvot {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י צִיּוֹן֙ הַיְקָרִ֔ים הַמְסֻלָּאִ֖ים בַּפָּ֑ז אֵיכָ֤ה נֶחְשְׁבוּ֙ לְנִבְלֵי־חֶ֔רֶשׂ מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יְדֵ֥י יוֹצֵֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
The precious children of Zion;
Once valued as gold—
Alas, they are accounted as earthen pots,
Work of a potter’s hands!
Transliteration: veney tsiyyvon hayekariym hamesulaiym vafaz eykhah necheshevu leniveley-cheresh maasheh yedey yvotser {s}

Hebrew: גַּם־[תַּנִּים֙] (תנין) חָ֣לְצוּ שַׁ֔ד הֵינִ֖יקוּ גּוּרֵיהֶ֑ן בַּת־עַמִּ֣י לְאַכְזָ֔ר (כי ענים) [כַּיְעֵינִ֖ים] בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Even jackals offer the breast
And suckle their young;
But my poor people has turned cruel,
Like ostriches of the desert.
Transliteration: gam-[taniym] (tnyn) chaletsu shad heyniyku gureyhen vat-amiy leakhezar (khy nym) [khayeeyniym] vamidevar {s}

Hebrew: דָּבַ֨ק לְשׁ֥וֹן יוֹנֵ֛ק אֶל־חִכּ֖וֹ בַּצָּמָ֑א עֽוֹלָלִים֙ שָׁ֣אֲלוּ לֶ֔חֶם פֹּרֵ֖שׂ אֵ֥ין לָהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
The tongue of the suckling cleaves
To its palate for thirst.
Little children beg for bread;
None gives them a morsel.
Transliteration: davak leshvon yvonek el-chikhvo vatsama volaliym shaalu lechem foresh eyn lahem {s}

Hebrew: הָאֹֽכְלִים֙ לְמַ֣עֲדַנִּ֔ים נָשַׁ֖מּוּ בַּחוּצ֑וֹת הָאֱמֻנִים֙ עֲלֵ֣י תוֹלָ֔ע חִבְּק֖וּ אַשְׁפַּתּֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
Those who feasted on dainties
Lie famished in the streets;
Those who were reared in purple
Have embraced refuse heaps.
Transliteration: haokheliym lemaadaniym nashamu vachutsvot haemuniym aley tvola chiveku ashefatvot {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּגְדַּל֙ עֲוֺ֣ן בַּת־עַמִּ֔י מֵֽחַטַּ֖את סְדֹ֑ם הַֽהֲפוּכָ֣ה כְמוֹ־רָ֔גַע וְלֹא־חָ֥לוּ בָ֖הּ יָדָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated:
The guilt of my poor people
Exceeded the iniquity of Sodom,
Which was overthrown in a moment,
Without a hand striking it.
Transliteration: vayigedal avon vat-amiy mechatat sedom hahafukhah khemvo-raga velo-chalu vah yadayiim {s}

Hebrew: זַכּ֤וּ נְזִירֶ֙יהָ֙ מִשֶּׁ֔לֶג צַח֖וּ מֵחָלָ֑ב אָ֤דְמוּ עֶ֙צֶם֙ מִפְּנִינִ֔ים סַפִּ֖יר גִּזְרָתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Her elect were purer than snow,
Whiter than milk;
Their limbs were ruddier than coral,
Their bodies were like sapphire.
Transliteration: zakhu neziyreyha misheleg tsachu mechalav ademu etsem mifeniyniym safiyr gizeratam {s}

Hebrew: חָשַׁ֤ךְ מִשְּׁחוֹר֙ תׇּֽאֳרָ֔ם לֹ֥א נִכְּר֖וּ בַּחוּצ֑וֹת צָפַ֤ד עוֹרָם֙ עַל־עַצְמָ֔ם יָבֵ֖שׁ הָיָ֥ה כָעֵֽץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Now their faces are blacker than soot,
They are not recognized in the streets;
Their skin has shriveled on their bones,
It has become dry as wood.
Transliteration: chashakhe mishechvor tׇoram lo nikheru vachutsvot tsafad voram al-atsemam yavesh hayah khaets {s}

Hebrew: טוֹבִ֤ים הָיוּ֙ חַלְלֵי־חֶ֔רֶב מֵֽחַלְלֵ֖י רָעָ֑ב שֶׁ֣הֵ֤ם יָזֻ֙בוּ֙ מְדֻקָּרִ֔ים מִתְּנוּבֹ֖ת שָׂדָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Better off were the slain of the sword
Than those slain by famine,
Who pined away, [as though] wounded,
For lack of the fruits of the field.
Transliteration: tvoviym hayu chaleley-cherev mechaleley raav shehem yazuvu medukariym mitenuvot shaday {s}

Hebrew: יְדֵ֗י נָשִׁים֙ רַחֲמָ֣נִיּ֔וֹת בִּשְּׁל֖וּ יַלְדֵיהֶ֑ן הָי֤וּ לְבָרוֹת֙ לָ֔מוֹ בְּשֶׁ֖בֶר בַּת־עַמִּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
With their own hands, tenderhearted women
Have cooked their children;
Such became their fare,
In the disaster of my poor people.
Transliteration: yedey nashiym rachamaniyyvot vishelu yaledeyhen hayu levarvot lamvo veshever vat-amiy {s}

Hebrew: כִּלָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־חֲמָת֔וֹ שָׁפַ֖ךְ חֲר֣וֹן אַפּ֑וֹ וַיַּצֶּת־אֵ֣שׁ בְּצִיּ֔וֹן וַתֹּ֖אכַל יְסֹדֹתֶֽיהָ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The LORD vented all His fury,
Poured out His blazing wrath;
He kindled a fire in Zion
Which consumed its foundations.
Transliteration: khilah yehovah et-chamatvo shafakhe charvon afvo vayatset-esh vetsiyyvon vatokhal yesodoteyha {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֤א הֶאֱמִ֙ינוּ֙ מַלְכֵי־אֶ֔רֶץ (וכל) [כֹּ֖ל] יֹשְׁבֵ֣י תֵבֵ֑ל כִּ֤י יָבֹא֙ צַ֣ר וְאוֹיֵ֔ב בְּשַׁעֲרֵ֖י יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated:
The kings of the earth did not believe,
Nor any of the inhabitants of the world,
That foe or adversary could enter
The gates of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: lo heemiynu malekhey-erets (vkhl) [khol] yoshevey tevel khiy yavo tsar vevoeiv veshaarey yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: מֵֽחַטֹּ֣אות נְבִיאֶ֔יהָ עֲוֺנֹ֖ת כֹּהֲנֶ֑יהָ הַשֹּׁפְכִ֥ים בְּקִרְבָּ֖הּ דַּ֥ם צַדִּיקִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
It was for the sins of her prophets,
The iniquities of her priests,
Who had shed in her midst
The blood of the just.
Transliteration: mechatovt neviyeyha avonot khohaneyha hashofekhiym vekirevah dam tsadiykiym {s}

Hebrew: נָע֤וּ עִוְרִים֙ בַּֽחוּצ֔וֹת נְגֹֽאֲל֖וּ בַּדָּ֑ם בְּלֹ֣א יֽוּכְל֔וּ יִגְּע֖וּ בִּלְבֻשֵׁיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
They wandered blindly through the streets,
Defiled with blood,
So that no one was able
To touch their garments.
Transliteration: nau iveriym vachutsvot negoalu vadam velo yukhelu yigeu vilevusheyhem {s}

Hebrew: ס֣וּרוּ טָמֵ֞א קָ֣רְאוּ לָ֗מוֹ ס֤וּרוּ ס֙וּרוּ֙ אַל־תִּגָּ֔עוּ כִּ֥י נָצ֖וּ גַּם־נָ֑עוּ אָֽמְרוּ֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם לֹ֥א יוֹסִ֖פוּ לָגֽוּר׃ {ס}
Translated:
“Away! Unclean!” people shouted at them,
“Away! Away! Touch not!”
So they wandered and wandered again;
For the nations had resolved:
“They shall stay here no longer.”
Transliteration: suru tame kareu lamvo suru suru al-tigau khiy natsu gam-nau ameru vagvoyim lo yvosifu lagur {s}

Hebrew: פְּנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ חִלְּקָ֔ם לֹ֥א יוֹסִ֖יף לְהַבִּיטָ֑ם פְּנֵ֤י כֹהֲנִים֙ לֹ֣א נָשָׂ֔אוּ (זקנים) [וּזְקֵנִ֖ים] לֹ֥א חָנָֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The LORD’s countenance has turned away from them,
He will look on them no more.
They showed no regard for priests,
No favor to elders.
Transliteration: feney yehovah chilekam lo yvosiyf lehaviytam feney khohaniym lo nashau (zknym) [uzekeniym] lo chananu {s}

Hebrew: (עודינה) [עוֹדֵ֙ינוּ֙] תִּכְלֶ֣ינָה עֵינֵ֔ינוּ אֶל־עֶזְרָתֵ֖נוּ הָ֑בֶל בְּצִפִּיָּתֵ֣נוּ צִפִּ֔ינוּ אֶל־גּ֖וֹי לֹ֥א יוֹשִֽׁעַ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Even now our eyes pine away
In vain for deliverance.
As we waited, still we wait
For a nation that cannot help.
Transliteration: (vdynh) [vodeynu] tikheleynah eyneynu el-ezeratenu havel vetsifiyatenu tsifiynu el-gvoy lo yvoshia {s}

Hebrew: צָד֣וּ צְעָדֵ֔ינוּ מִלֶּ֖כֶת בִּרְחֹבֹתֵ֑ינוּ קָרַ֥ב קִצֵּ֛נוּ מָלְא֥וּ יָמֵ֖ינוּ כִּי־בָ֥א קִצֵּֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Our steps were checked,
We could not walk in our squares.
Our doom is near, our days are done—
Alas, our doom has come!
Transliteration: tsadu tseadeynu milekhet virechovoteynu karav kitsenu maleu yameynu khiy-va kitsenu {s}

Hebrew: קַלִּ֤ים הָיוּ֙ רֹדְפֵ֔ינוּ מִנִּשְׁרֵ֖י שָׁמָ֑יִם עַל־הֶהָרִ֣ים דְּלָקֻ֔נוּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר אָ֥רְבוּ לָֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Our pursuers were swifter
Than the eagles in the sky;
They chased us in the mountains,
Lay in wait for us in the wilderness.
Transliteration: kaliym hayu rodefeynu minisherey shamayiim al-hehariym delakunu vamidevar arevu lanu {s}

Hebrew: ר֤וּחַ אַפֵּ֙ינוּ֙ מְשִׁ֣יחַ יְהֹוָ֔ה נִלְכַּ֖ד בִּשְׁחִיתוֹתָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֔רְנוּ בְּצִלּ֖וֹ נִֽחְיֶ֥ה בַגּוֹיִֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
The breath of our life, the LORD’s anointed,
Was captured in their traps—
He in whose shade we had thought
To live among the nations.
Transliteration: rucha afeynu meshiycha yehovah nilekhad vishechiytvotam asher amarenu vetsilvo nicheyeh vagvoyim {s}

Hebrew: שִׂ֤ישִׂי וְשִׂמְחִי֙ בַּת־אֱד֔וֹם (יושבתי) [יוֹשֶׁ֖בֶת] בְּאֶ֣רֶץ ע֑וּץ גַּם־עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ תַּעֲבׇר־כּ֔וֹס תִּשְׁכְּרִ֖י וְתִתְעָרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Rejoice and exult, Fair Edom,
Who dwell in the land of Uz!
To you, too, the cup shall pass,
You shall get drunk and expose your nakedness.
Transliteration: shiyshiy veshimechiy vat-edvom (yvshvty) [yvoshevet] veerets uts gam-alayiikhe taavׇr-khvos tishekheriy vetiteariy {s}

Hebrew: תַּם־עֲוֺנֵךְ֙ בַּת־צִיּ֔וֹן לֹ֥א יוֹסִ֖יף לְהַגְלוֹתֵ֑ךְ פָּקַ֤ד עֲוֺנֵךְ֙ בַּת־אֱד֔וֹם גִּלָּ֖ה עַל־חַטֹּאתָֽיִךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Your iniquity, Fair Zion, is expiated;
He will exile you no longer.
Your iniquity, Fair Edom, He will note;
He will uncover your sins.
Transliteration: tam-avonekhe vat-tsiyyvon lo yvosiyf lehagelvotekhe fakad avonekhe vat-edvom gilah al-chatotayiikhe {f}

Hebrew: זְכֹ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ מֶֽה־הָ֣יָה לָ֔נוּ (הביט) [הַבִּ֖יטָה] וּרְאֵ֥ה אֶת־חֶרְפָּתֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Remember, O LORD, what has befallen us;
Behold, and see our disgrace!
Transliteration: zekhor yehovah meh-hayah lanu (hvyt) [haviytah] ureeh et-cherefatenu

Hebrew: נַחֲלָתֵ֙נוּ֙ נֶֽהֶפְכָ֣ה לְזָרִ֔ים בָּתֵּ֖ינוּ לְנׇכְרִֽים׃
Translated:
Our heritage has passed to aliens,
Our homes to strangers.
Transliteration: nachalatenu nehefekhah lezariym vateynu lenׇkheriym

Hebrew: יְתוֹמִ֤ים הָיִ֙ינוּ֙ (אין) [וְאֵ֣ין] אָ֔ב אִמֹּתֵ֖ינוּ כְּאַלְמָנֽוֹת׃
Translated:
We have become orphans, fatherless;
Our mothers are like widows.
Transliteration: yetvomiym hayiynu (yn) [veeyn] av imoteynu khealemanvot

Hebrew: מֵימֵ֙ינוּ֙ בְּכֶ֣סֶף שָׁתִ֔ינוּ עֵצֵ֖ינוּ בִּמְחִ֥יר יָבֹֽאוּ׃
Translated:
We must pay to drink our own water,
Obtain our own kindling at a price.
Transliteration: meymeynu vekhesef shatiynu etseynu vimechiyr yavou

Hebrew: עַ֤ל צַוָּארֵ֙נוּ֙ נִרְדָּ֔פְנוּ יָגַ֖עְנוּ (לא) [וְלֹ֥א] הֽוּנַֽח־לָֽנוּ׃
Translated:
We are hotly pursued;
Exhausted, we are given no rest.
Transliteration: al tsavarenu niredafenu yagaenu (l) [velo] hunach-lanu

Hebrew: מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ נָתַ֣נּוּ יָ֔ד אַשּׁ֖וּר לִשְׂבֹּ֥עַֽ לָֽחֶם׃
Translated:
We hold out a hand to Egypt;
To Assyria, for our fill of bread.
Transliteration: mitserayiim natanu yad ashur lishevoa lachem

Hebrew: אֲבֹתֵ֤ינוּ חָֽטְאוּ֙ (אינם) [וְאֵינָ֔ם] (אנחנו) [וַאֲנַ֖חְנוּ] עֲוֺנֹתֵיהֶ֥ם סָבָֽלְנוּ׃
Translated:
Our fathers sinned and are no more;
And we must bear their guilt.
Transliteration: avoteynu chateu (ynm) [veeynam] (nchnv) [vaanachenu] avonoteyhem savalenu

Hebrew: עֲבָדִים֙ מָ֣שְׁלוּ בָ֔נוּ פֹּרֵ֖ק אֵ֥ין מִיָּדָֽם׃
Translated:
Slaves are ruling over us,
With none to rescue us from them.
Transliteration: avadiym mashelu vanu forek eyn miyadam

Hebrew: בְּנַפְשֵׁ֙נוּ֙ נָבִ֣יא לַחְמֵ֔נוּ מִפְּנֵ֖י חֶ֥רֶב הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated:
We get our bread at the peril of our lives,
Because of the sword of the wilderness.
Transliteration: venafeshenu naviy lachemenu mifeney cherev hamidevar

Hebrew: עוֹרֵ֙נוּ֙ כְּתַנּ֣וּר נִכְמָ֔רוּ מִפְּנֵ֖י זַלְעֲפ֥וֹת רָעָֽב׃
Translated:
Our skin glows like an oven,
With the fever of famine.
Transliteration: vorenu khetanur nikhemaru mifeney zaleafvot raav

Hebrew: נָשִׁים֙ בְּצִיּ֣וֹן עִנּ֔וּ בְּתֻלֹ֖ת בְּעָרֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated:
They have ravished women in Zion,
Maidens in the towns of Judah.
Transliteration: nashiym vetsiyyvon inu vetulot vearey yehudah

Hebrew: שָׂרִים֙ בְּיָדָ֣ם נִתְל֔וּ פְּנֵ֥י זְקֵנִ֖ים לֹ֥א נֶהְדָּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Princes have been hanged by them;
No respect has been shown to elders.
Transliteration: shariym veyadam nitelu feney zekeniym lo nehedaru

Hebrew: בַּחוּרִים֙ טְח֣וֹן נָשָׂ֔אוּ וּנְעָרִ֖ים בָּעֵ֥ץ כָּשָֽׁלוּ׃
Translated:
Young men must carry millstones,
And youths stagger under loads of wood.
Transliteration: vachuriym techvon nashau uneariym vaets khashalu

Hebrew: זְקֵנִים֙ מִשַּׁ֣עַר שָׁבָ֔תוּ בַּחוּרִ֖ים מִנְּגִינָתָֽם׃
Translated:
The old men are gone from the gate,
The young men from their music.
Transliteration: zekeniym mishaar shavatu vachuriym minegiynatam

Hebrew: שָׁבַת֙ מְשׂ֣וֹשׂ לִבֵּ֔נוּ נֶהְפַּ֥ךְ לְאֵ֖בֶל מְחֹלֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Gone is the joy of our hearts;
Our dancing is turned into mourning.
Transliteration: shavat meshvosh livenu nehefakhe leevel mecholenu

Hebrew: נָֽפְלָה֙ עֲטֶ֣רֶת רֹאשֵׁ֔נוּ אֽוֹי־נָ֥א לָ֖נוּ כִּ֥י חָטָֽאנוּ׃
Translated:
The crown has fallen from our head;
Woe to us that we have sinned!
Transliteration: nafelah ateret roshenu voy-na lanu khiy chatanu

Hebrew: עַל־זֶ֗ה הָיָ֤ה דָוֶה֙ לִבֵּ֔נוּ עַל־אֵ֖לֶּה חָשְׁכ֥וּ עֵינֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
Because of this our hearts are sick,
Because of these our eyes are dimmed:
Transliteration: al-zeh hayah daveh livenu al-eleh chashekhu eyneynu

Hebrew: עַ֤ל הַר־צִיּוֹן֙ שֶׁשָּׁמֵ֔ם שׁוּעָלִ֖ים הִלְּכוּ־בֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Because of Mount Zion, which lies desolate;
Jackals prowl over it.
Transliteration: al har-tsiyyvon sheshamem shualiym hilekhu-vvo {f}

Hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לְעוֹלָ֣ם תֵּשֵׁ֔ב כִּסְאֲךָ֖ לְד֥וֹר וָדֽוֹר׃
Translated:
But You, O LORD, are enthroned forever,
Your throne endures through the ages.
Transliteration: atah yehovah levolam teshev khiseakha ledvor vadvor

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה לָנֶ֙צַח֙ תִּשְׁכָּחֵ֔נוּ תַּֽעַזְבֵ֖נוּ לְאֹ֥רֶךְ יָמִֽים׃
Translated:
Why have You forgotten us utterly,
Forsaken us for all time?
Transliteration: lamah lanetsach tishekhachenu taazevenu leorekhe yamiym

Hebrew: הֲשִׁיבֵ֨נוּ יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ (ונשוב) [וְֽנָשׁ֔וּבָה] חַדֵּ֥שׁ יָמֵ֖ינוּ כְּקֶֽדֶם׃
Translated:
Take us back, O LORD, to Yourself,
And let us come back;
Renew our days as of old!
Transliteration: hashiyvenu yehovah eleykha (vnshvv) [venashuvah] chadesh yameynu khekedem

Hebrew: כִּ֚י אִם־מָאֹ֣ס מְאַסְתָּ֔נוּ קָצַ֥פְתָּ עָלֵ֖ינוּ עַד־מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
For truly, You have rejected us,
Bitterly raged against us.

Take us back, O LORD, to Yourself,
And let us come back;
Renew our days as of old!
Transliteration: khiy im-maos measetanu katsafeta aleynu ad-meod
